SEARCH
Package DBHelper

Class DBHelper

java.lang.Object
DBHelper.DBHelper
Direct Known Subclasses:
Movies
public class DBHelper extends Object
The DBHelper class provides utility methods for interacting with the SQLite database.

This class is responsible for establishing a connection to the SQLite database, executing queries, and retrieving results. It includes database connection variables for managing the connection, statement, and result set. The class ensures that the application can interact with the database to perform operations such as adding, removing, and retrieving movie data.

The class includes the following key components:

  • DATABASE_NAME - Path to the SQLite database file for practice.
  • connection - Connection object for establishing a connection to the database.
  • statement - Statement object for executing SQL queries.
  • resultSet - ResultSet object for holding the data returned by queries.
See Also:
  • Connection
  • Statement
  • ResultSet

      represents the connection to the SQLite database, It is used to establish and manage communication between the Java application and the database.

  • Constructor Details

    • DBHelper

      public DBHelper()
      Constructor that initializes the connection variables to null, This is used to set up the DBHelper object for subsequent database interactions.

  • Method Details

    • connect

      private void connect()
      Establishes a connection to the SQLite database. This method loads the JDBC driver for SQLite, establishes a connection to the database file, and initializes a statement object for executing queries.

    • close

      private void close()
      Closes the database connection and releases any associated resources. This method ensures that the database connection, statement, and result set are properly closed to avoid resource leaks.

    • arrayListTo2DArray

      private Object[][] arrayListTo2DArray(ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> list)
      Converts an ArrayList of ArrayLists into a 2D Object array. This utility method is used to transform data retrieved from the database into a format suitable for table display.
      Parameters:
      list - the ArrayList of ArrayLists to be converted
      Returns:
      a 2D Object array representing the data

    • execute

      protected void execute(String sql)
      Executes a SQL command that does not return a result set, such as CRUD operations. This method connects to the database, executes the provided SQL command, and closes the connection.
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL command to be executed

    • executeQueryToTable

      protected DefaultTableModel executeQueryToTable(String sql)
      Executes a SQL query and returns the result as a DefaultTableModel for displaying in a GUI. This method retrieves the data from the result set, formats it as a table model, and returns it for further use.
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL query to be executed
      Returns:
      a DefaultTableModel containing the query results for GUI display

    • executeQuery

      protected ArrayList<ArrayList<Object>> executeQuery(String sql)
      Executes a SQL query and returns the result as an ArrayList of ArrayLists. This method retrieves data from the result set and stores it in an ArrayList for further processing.
      Parameters:
      sql - the SQL query to be executed
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of ArrayLists containing the query results
